modules.description: Provides operations to calculate the weight of a buffer and extract sub-buffers by offset and length. Works with an opaque buffer type representing a sequence of bytes. Used to efficiently manipulate portions of large binary data structures.

Provides operations to calculate the weight and byte length of a buffer, shift bytes within a buffer, split a buffer at a specific offset, and attempt to merge two buffers into a single one. Works with a buffer type representing a sequence of bytes. Used to manipulate network packet data and manage memory-efficient data transfers.

Encodes values into human-readable formats while adhering to RFC 822 line length constraints, inserting forced whitespace tokens where needed. It handles lists, strings, and structured data, ensuring content fits within 80 columns. Used to format email headers, such as lists of addresses, with proper line breaks and spacing.

Calculates and manipulates buffer properties such as weight and byte length, supports shifting, splitting, and merging operations on byte sequences. Handles efficient extraction and modification of binary data through offset and length parameters. Enables precise control over network packet data and large binary structures. Examples include splitting a buffer at a specific position, merging two buffers into one, and calculating the exact size of a sub-buffer.
